servant of this country''. David Cameron said he was saddened by his departure, adding he felt his communications director was`` being punished twice for the same offence.'' The PM said: This is all about the past. It has gone on and on and I can understand why he feels the pressure of that.`` I choose to judge him by the work he has done for me for the government and for the country. He has run the Downing Street press office in a very straightforward, professional and competent way . David Cameron said he compared Andy Coulson 's regime favourably to`` the days of dodgy dossiers, Alastair Campbell , Damian McBride , and all that nonsense we had from the past government''. Sunday. Media reports during Egypt's political unrest had quoted Zahi Hawass as saying that looters damaged two mummies, but in a BBC interview on Sunday he said that this was not the case. They were not mummies, there were two skulls taken outside from the CT scan machine. Everything will go back to normal at Cairo Museum today, said Zahi Hawass , head of Egypt's antiquities authority since 2002. He was made a cabinet minister last week. Allen Iverson had 32 points and 12 assists Wednesday night, and the Nuggets used a late run to beat the Grizzlies 106-102. This was a big win for us at somebody else's home, Allen Iverson said.`` Down seven points with 3 minutes to go. It was a gut check for us.
